content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 2 in the provided graph is:

4 -> 7 -> 2

This path has length 3 and uses the edges (4, 7), (7, 2). Please note that the path you provide should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

2 -> 3 -> 5 -> 4

This path has length 3 and uses the edges (2, 3), (3, 5), (5, 4). Please note that the path you provide should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.
